title: Thick brush script
content:
Does anyone recognize this typeface or know of a few that are similar to it?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [type6.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/typophile.com/files/type6.jpg) | 97 KB |
author: brownie616

comments.content:
I don't think this is a font, because some of the letters are hard to read (that 'a' is more like a 'q'), and because the identical letters don't look the same.

[Elizabeth Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/kimmy/elizabeth-script/?refby=bowfin) is sort of uneven and quirky like your sample.

- Mike Yanega
Calligraphy as Mike says - not a font

alright well would you be able to tell me if a typeface exists that looks a little more like this? If not what do you think letters like this were made from like a brush and ink or a bamboo pen?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947im_/http:/typophile.com/files/6c98ef329bfc717761ec9da5219f8c4c_5882.jpg)

alright well would you be able to tell me if a typeface exists that looks a little more like this? If not what do you think letters like this were made from like a brush and ink or a bamboo pen?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947im_/http:/typophile.com/files/6c98ef329bfc717761ec9da5219f8c4c_5882.jpg)

Brush (like the kind used for traditional Japanese or Chinese calligraphy) and ink.

I've never encountered a font that mimics this look--most typefaces are more uniform. Other options to add to the suggestion above:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/andinistas/chefscript/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/andinistas/chefscript/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/andinistas/chefscript/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emily-lime/jacques-and-gilles/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emily-lime/jacques-and-gilles/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emily-lime/jacques-and-gilles/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/magpiepaperworks/saissant/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/magpiepaperworks/saissant/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/magpiepaperworks/saissant/")
Nice suggestion, Nick, and much closer than my attempts....

Good find Nick. Gizmo really has the feel of brush or bamboo pen ink soaking unevenly into paper. I believe most readers would not notice that most letters are formed completely differently than the ID sample.  
Don

Nick made Gizmo.

Nick - just a heads up that the Trademarks link doesn't work.

Thanks Mike for the clarification.  
Congrats Nick on a unique font.  
Don
Thanks. The trademark link has nothing to do eith me. I don't actually sell Gizmo on my site as I haven't updated it to OpenType yet.

Some more gathered from previous discussions: [HungLan Design fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.hunglandesign.com/?page_id=7), [Fashionista](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bluevinyl/fashionista-bv/), [Pincel](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/corradine/pincel/), [DEADman](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/volcano/deadman/), [Arnova](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/arnova/), [Lassigue D'mato](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/lassigue-dmato/), [Baka](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/baka/), [Cocobella](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/cultivated-mind/cocobella/), [Pastiche Brush](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/schizotype/pastiche-brush), [Gizmo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/gtype/gizmo), [Imitation Three](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/haroldsfonts.com/groups/i), [dearJoeHannes](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/joebob/dearjoehannes), [Huland Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.dafont.com/hunglan-design.d674) fonts, [Feminine Lifetime](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.ffonts.net/Feminine-Lifetime.font), [Mano Negra](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/WC-Mano-Negra-Bta), [Brushed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/design/brushed), [Dead Island](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.ffonts.net/Dead-Island.font), [Levi Brush](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.dafont.com/levibrush.font), [Levi ReBrushed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.dafont.com/levirebrushed.font), [Painter's Hand](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.letteringdelights.com/bundle:all-time_font_favorites_bundle-8698.html), [Edmonsson](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/m-b-creative/mb-edwardsson)

Carumba Plain is something I've used before which, despite not being script, has a heavy brush look to it:

[http://www.fonts.com/font/itc/carumba/carumba](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225133947/http:/www.fonts.com/font/itc/carumba/carumba "http://www.fonts.com/font/itc/carumba/carumba")
